description: Creates a unique key that you can distribute to clients who invoke your API.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: API keys are a form of credentials that attackers can use to gain and maintain access to cloud services.
Attackers may manipulate API keys to alter account permissions and settings, maintaining persistence and access.
API keys can be used to remove legitimate accounts, thereby maintaining persistence and disrupting normal operations.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.technique: T1550.001 - Use Alternate Authentication Material: Application Access Token
unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: API keys serve as alternate authentication material, in this case as application access tokens to access AppSync APIs.
Attackers can use API keys to route their malicious traffic through a AppSync, which acts here as a proxy, hiding their true origin and bypassing security measures.

researchLinks.description: Distorting the Sync: How AWS AppSync Can Be Turned into an Attacker’s Backdoor

securityImplications: Attackers might use CreateApiKey to add a key they control for authentication. Bypassing current authentication and potentially allowing persistent access to data.
